isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - SINGLE SPEED AXLE: SPICER - PINION POSITION - PINION SETTING CHART

svcproc.title: PINION SETTING CHART
svcproc.para: Use a micrometer to measure thickness of old pinion shims. Measure each shim separately and add together to get total thickness of original build-up.

note.para: If old pinion shims are bent or mutilated, they should be replaced.

svcproc.para: If a new gear set is being used, notice the (+), (-) or "0" etching on both the old and new pinions, and adjust the thickness of the shims to compensate for the difference of these two figures (as shown in the Pinion Setting Chart).
For example, if the old pinion is etched +2, and the new pinion is -2, subtract .004 inch from the thickness of original shims used to position pinion.
Use this chart as a guideline to set pinion (dimension in inches is on top and in millimeters on bottom).
